info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 13 at 4:33PM EDT until May 13 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg VA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Virginia, including the following county and independent cities, City of Roanoke, City of Salem and Roanoke.
* WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 430 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Several rounds of thunderstorms are expected this evening. Minor flooding is likely.
- This includes the following streams and drainages... Brake Branch, Big Bear Rock Branch, Back Creek, Carvin Creek and Buffalo Creek. Rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Roanoke... Salem... Vinton... Catawba... Bent Mountain... Cave Spring... Poages Mill... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Roanoke, VA; City of Roanoke, VA; City of Salem, VA
